abstract: Parliament passed a resolution urging the government to allow the United Nations to investigate the death of Benazir Bhutto, the former prime minister who was killed Dec. 27, after addressing a political rally. Officials of her party, which now leads the government, have expressed dissatisfaction with the inquiry conducted by the previous government of allies of President Pervez Musharraf.
lead_paragraph: Parliament passed a resolution urging the government to allow the United Nations to investigate the death of Benazir Bhutto, the former prime minister who was killed Dec. 27, after addressing a political rally. Officials of her party, which now leads the government, have expressed dissatisfaction with the inquiry conducted by the previous government of allies of President Pervez Musharraf.

headline.main: Pakistan: Parliament Seeks U.N. Inquiry for Bhutto
